metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12371 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An integer overflow vulnerability in the Skia library when allocating memory for edge builders on some systems with at least 16 GB of RAM. This results in the use of uninitialized memory, resulting in a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 60.1, Thunderbird < 60, and Firefox < 61.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12371` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-globalmenu - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-mozsymbols - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
firefox-testsuite - 61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '61.0+build3-0ubuntu0.14.04.2').
